title: Is it the end for Mitch and Mark? Drama on The Block takes 'serious toll' on their relationship
text:
'Stylish grandads' Mitch Edwards and Mark McKie are front-runners to win The Block, thanks to always finishing renovations on time and winning numerous room reveals.

But according to new reports, the drama on the renovation show has taken a 'serious toll' on their relationship.

According to Woman's Day, Mitch looked 'emotional' as he 'walked off set with his bags', sparking rumours of a break-up.

Oh, no! According to new reports, the drama on The Block has taken a 'serious toll' on Mitch Edwards and Mark McKie's relationship

A source claimed that Mitch stormed off set and looked ready to quit the show ahead of the highly-anticipated finale.

'It's been one of the most challenging things we've ever done, with the highs and lows that come with such a big project,' the pair told Woman's Day.

It comes amid fears that the couple may not even finish the show due to an unexpected 'budget blowout'.

Shocking claims: A source told Woman's Day that Mitch stormed off set and looked ready to quit the show ahead of the highly-anticipated finale

As reported by TV Week, the couple discover on the show this week that they have run out of money and may not complete their build.

Mitch described the situation as 'devastating'.

El'ise, meanwhile, told the magazine that she was not surprised by Mitch and Mark's overspending after seeing how many tradesmen they had hired.

Bills, bills, bills! Meanwhile, TV Week is reporting that Mitch and Mark may not even finish the show due to an unexpected 'budget blowout'

Budget blowout: El'ise (left, with her husband Mark) said she was not surprised by Mitch and Mark's overspending after seeing how many tradesmen they had hired

'They had many, many trades on site non-stop. Matt's a chippie and we had one person on site with him the whole time. We could never make sense of it,' she said.

On Sunday's episode of The Block, villainous contestant Jesse slammed Mitch and Mark's house after they won the latest room reveal by half a point.

In a savage assessment, Jesse told producers that their renovation looks like a 'public toilet.'

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Channel Nine for comment.
